content.text: On which day were most skirts sold?
How many skirts were sold on Wednesday?
Work out how many more skirts were sold on Friday than on Thursday
The pictogram shows the number of skirts that were sold each day in one week
Key: \(\bigcirc = 10\) skirts
The shop is open for 6 days each week
On each day, the shop is open from 09 30 until 13 00 and from 14 15 until 20 30
Work out the total number of hours the shop is open in one week
Nadira pays 6 people to work in the shop
In one week
• 4 people each work for 38 hours
• 2 people each work for 25 hours
They are each paid \(11.40 for each hour they work
Calculate the total amount Nadira pays these 6 people in one week
Nadira has some T-shirts that are either white or blue or green
The numbers of T-shirts are in the ratio white : blue : green = 5 : 4 : 1
48 of the T-shirts are blue
Work out the total number of T-shirts
Nadira buys a pack of 40 dresses and pays \(\) 500
She sells 35 of these dresses for \(\$ 22\) each
She sells the remaining 5 dresses for \(\$ 14.50\) each
Calculate the percentage profit she makes when she sells all 40 dresses
Nadira owns a clothes shop
Complete Henry's shopping bill

content.text: Calculate the area of the floor
Henry buys varnish for the floor of the room
500 ml of varnish covers \(8\mathrm{m}^2\) of floor
Calculate the amount of varnish Henry needs
The diagram shows the floor of the room
This scale drawing shows the window in the room
The scale is 1 centimetre represents 40 centimetres
Scale: 1 cm to 40 cm
Work out the actual length and height of the window
The diagram shows one wall of the room
Calculate the area of the wall
Henry buys a circular mirror for the room
The diameter of the mirror is \(80\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the circumference of the mirror
Henry decorates a room
all the factors of 18,
a square number between 30 and 50,
a prime number between 90 and 100
Write down
Put one pair of brackets into each calculation to make it correct
Calculate
Give your answer correct to 2 decimal places
Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 36 and 90
Find the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 36 and 90
Write \(4.2 \times 10^{- 3}\) as an ordinary number
Give your answer in standard form
The results for the remaining 40 students are recorded in the table
Complete the table to show the results for all 50 students
Write down the range
Find the median
Find the percentage of the 50 students who drink 4 glasses of water
One of the 50 students is chosen at random
Find the probability that this student drinks fewer than 2 glasses of water in one day
Give your answer as a fraction in its lowest terms
50 students each record the number of glasses of water they drink in one day
The results for 10 of the students are shown below
Musa has a glass that holds \(250\mathrm{ml}\) of water
He drinks 5 of these glasses of water
He fills his glass from a 2-litre bottle of water
Work out how much water is left in the bottle
Give your answer in millilitres
The amount of water, \(w\) litres, in a jug is 1.5 litres, correct to the nearest 0.1 litre
Complete this statement about the value of \(w\)
Another glass is in the shape of a cylinder
The cylinder has height \(15\mathrm{cm}\) and diameter \(7\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the volume of the glass
Using a ruler and compasses only, construct triangle \(ABC.\)
\(AB\) has been drawn for you
A
Measure angle \(ABC.\)
In triangle \(ABC, AC = 7 \text{cm}\) and \(BC = 5 \text{cm}\)
Find angle \(PQS.\)
Find angle \(PSR.\)
The diagram shows triangle \(PRS\) and a straight line \(QS.\)
\(Q\) is a point on \(PR.\)
Angle \(QRS = 25^{\circ}\), angle \(RSQ = 32^{\circ}\) and \(PS = QS.\)
Find angle \(DEF\)
\(EF = 12 \text{cm}\)
Calculate \(DF\)
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\), with diameter \(EF\)
Angle \(DFE = 63^{\circ}\)
Complete the table of values for \(y = x^{2} - 5x + 3\)
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} - 5x + 3\) for \(-1 \leqslant x \leqslant 6\)
Use your graph to solve the equation \(x^{2} - 5x + 3 = 0\)
Write down the next term
Write down the rule for continuing the sequence
Here are the first four terms of a sequence
The \(n\)th term of another sequence is \(n^{2} + 2n\)
Find the first three terms of this sequence
Complete the table
Find an expression, in terms of \(n\), for the number of lines in Pattern \(n\)
Jake says that he can make one of these patterns using exactly 105 lines
Explain, without doing any working, why he is wrong
Here are the first three patterns in a sequence
Write down the co-ordinates of point \(P\)
Write down the column vector \(\overrightarrow{PQ}\)
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps triangle \(A\) onto triangle \(B\)
On the grid, draw the image of triangle \(A\) after a translation by the vector \(\binom{4}{-2}\)
On the grid, draw the image of triangle \(A\) after a rotation through \(90^{\circ}\) clockwise about (0, 0).
The diagram shows two triangles, \(A\) and \(B\), and two points \(P\) and \(Q\)
Find the value of \(c\) when \(a = 8\) and \(b = -3\)
Make \(a\) the subject of the formula \(c = 5a - 2b\)
Factorise \(3x + 12\)
Expand \(x(2y + x)\)
Cara has \(n\) pencils
Alice has twice as many pencils as Cara
Leon has three more pencils than Alice
The three children have a total of 58 pencils
Use this information to write down an equation and solve it to find the value of \(n\)
